item.title: Segantii 因内幕交易指控放弃香港办事处
item.description: 熟悉内幕交易案的人士称，内幕交易案的核心对冲基金公司 Segantii Capital Management 已离开其位于香港的占地 12,000 平方英尺的办公室。【原文：Segantii Capital Management, the hedge fund firm at the center of an insider trading case, has left its 12,000-square-foot office in Hong Kong, said people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本央行通过地区报告发出仍将加息的信号
item.description: 日本央行上调了对两个地区经济体的评估，表明其仍在考虑更多的加息措施，同时也几乎没有证据表明需要立即采取行动。【原文：The Bank of Japan indicated it remains on track to consider more interest rate hikes by upgrading its assessments for two regional economies, while also offering little evidence of any need for immediate action.】

item.title: 收购竞争对手后，意大利天然气公司目标到 2030 年盈利 28 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利燃气公司（Italgas SpA）在完成收购竞争对手 2i Rete Gas 的交易后表示，其新计划的目标是到 2030 年实现近 30 亿欧元（33 亿美元）的利润。【原文：Italgas SpA said its new plan targets nearly €3 billion ($3.3 billion) in profit by 2030 after the gas distributor sealed a deal to buy rival 2i Rete Gas.】

item.title: 高盛将明年美国经济衰退概率降至 15
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The probability for a US recession over the next year is back at the long-term average of 15% after a blowout payrolls report for September reduced the chances for such a downturn, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. economists said.】

item.title: 瑞典央行降息后瑞典长期通胀预期上升
item.description: 在瑞典中央银行下调基准利率并为未来几个月的更大幅度降息敞开大门之后公布的一项调查显示，瑞典的长期通胀率预期有所上升。【原文：Expectations for Sweden’s long-term inflation rate rose somewhat in a survey published after the central bank reduced its benchmark rate and opened the door to larger cuts in the months ahead.】

item.title: 金属市场关注中国重开为刺激经济反弹提供线索
item.description: 中国多年来最大规模的经济刺激计划为大宗商品注入了一针强心剂。周二内地市场的重新开市将让人们看到反弹是否还有空间。【原文：China’s largest stimulus package in years has given commodities a shot in the arm. The reopening of mainland markets on Tuesday will provide a sense of whether the rally has room to run.】

item.title: 哈利法克斯称英国房价连续第三个月攀升
item.description: 哈利法克斯（Halifax）的数据显示，由于更便宜的抵押贷款和收入增加刺激了更多购房者进入市场，9月份英国房价连续第三个月攀升。【原文：UK house prices climbed for a third consecutive month in September as cheaper mortgages and increased incomes spurred more buyers into the market, data from Halifax showed.】

item.title: 壳牌第三季度炼油利润率下降，化工业务亏损
item.description: 壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）第三季度炼油利润率下降，预计化工业务将出现亏损，这一表现反映了经济的普遍疲软。【原文：Shell Plc saw refining margins decline in the third quarter and expects to lose money in its chemicals business, a performance that reflects the broader weakening of the economy.】

item.title: 房东 SBB 将以 3.9 亿美元出售住房部门股份
item.description: 瑞典房东 SBB 计划出售其住宅部门价值多达 40 亿瑞典克朗（约合 3.9 亿美元）的股票，以巩固其资产负债表。【原文：Swedish landlord SBB plans to sell as much as 4 billion Swedish kronor ($390 million) worth of stock in its residential unit in an effort to shore up its balance sheet.】

item.title: 德国工厂订单下降，再现行业困境
item.description: 德国 8 月份的工厂订单急剧下降，标志着在欧洲最大经济体未能实现期待已久的复苏的这一年里，工业又一次遭受挫折。【原文：Factory orders in Germany plummeted in August, marking yet another setback for industry in a year when Europe’s biggest economy has failed to deliver a much-awaited recovery.】

item.title: 乌克兰称袭击克里米亚 Feodosia 油港
item.description: 乌克兰军方称，乌克兰军队一夜之间对俄罗斯占领的克里米亚的一个石油码头发动了导弹袭击。【原文：Ukrainian forces launched a missile attack on an oil terminal in Russian-occupied Crimea overnight, the military said.】

item.title: 英国英镑逆势上涨后正处于转折点
item.description: 市场对英镑的信心在经历了举世瞩目的大涨之后正在崩溃。【原文：The market’s confidence in the pound is shattering after a world-beating run.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将反弹，英镑守住上周跌幅
item.description: 2020 年 10 月 14 日星期三，英国伦敦，在这张排列整齐的照片中，一组一英镑硬币矗立在五英镑、十英镑和二十英镑纸币之上。英国首相鲍里斯-约翰逊（Boris Johnson）自设的与欧盟达成贸易协议的最后期限（10 月 15 日）迫在眉睫，但英镑交易员们却表现得异常淡定。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：A cluster of one pound sterling coins stand on top of five, ten and twenty pound banknotes in this arranged photograph in London, U.K., on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2020. Pound traders are remarkably nonchalant even as U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson's self-imposed deadline of Oct. 15 to get a trade deal with the European Union looms large. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 债务危机迫在眉睫，马尔代夫寻求修复与印度的关系
item.description: 一年前，马尔代夫总统在一场运动中一举上台，将印度赶出了这个岛国的事务，并向中国靠拢。现在，随着债务危机的逼近和中国早前贷款的到期，他正在新德里寻求修补一些关系。【原文：The president of the Maldives swept into power a year ago on a campaign to push India out of the island nation’s affairs and draw closer to China. Now, as a debt crisis looms and earlier Chinese loans come due, he is in New Delhi looking to mend some fences.】

item.title: LG 能源希望通过扩大非电动汽车业务将销售额翻番
item.description: 电池制造商 LG Energy Solution Ltd. 表示，计划通过积极拓展储能系统等非电动汽车业务，到 2028 年将销售额翻一番以上。【原文：Battery maker LG Energy Solution Ltd. said it plans to more than double sales by 2028, through aggressively expanding non-electric vehicle businesses such as energy storage system.】

item.title: 进口商称确保能源安全需要液化天然气几十年
item.description: 一个液化天然气进口商行业组织周一强调，即使全球转向使用更清洁的能源，液化天然气仍将需要使用几十年，以确保充足的能源供应。【原文：Liquefied natural gas will be needed for decades to ensure adequate energy supply, even as the world shifts to cleaner sources, an industry group of importers emphasized on Monday.】

item.title: 欧盟对中国电动汽车关税投 "赞成 "票被视为报复目标
item.description: 欧盟决定对中国电动汽车征收关税，使人们开始关注中国政府将如何以及何时采取报复行动，以应对多年来与欧盟之间最大贸易争端的升级。【原文：The European Union’s decision to impose tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles has moved the focus to how and when Beijing will retaliate for the escalation in its biggest trade dispute with the bloc in years.】

item.description: 中国最大的芯片制造商中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp.【原文：Top Chinese chipmaker Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. led a $13 billion sector rally, after investors bet that Beijing will declare more policy or financial support for an industry central to its geopolitical ambitions.】

item.title: 罢工僵持两周后波音重启工资谈判
item.description: 在波音公司试图以直接向工人发出要约的粗暴举动结束罢工并以失败告终两周后，这家飞机制造商和其最大的工会再次尝试以更传统的协商和穿梭外交模式来结束僵局。【原文：Two weeks after Boeing Co. tried and failed to end a strike with the brash move of a direct offer to workers, the planemaker and its largest union are taking another stab at a more conventional pattern of consultation and shuttle diplomacy to end the stalemate.】

item.title: 全球投资者囤积现金押注台湾人工智能回归
item.description: 外国投资者在台湾持有数十亿美元的现金，这对股票多头来说是一个令人鼓舞的迹象，他们预测近期市场的下跌将是短暂的。【原文：Foreign investors are sitting on billions of dollars of cash in Taiwan, an encouraging sign for equity bulls predicting that a recent market decline will be short-lived.】

item.title: 铁矿石走高，因希望中国出台更多刺激政策
item.description: 由于市场猜测中国最高经济规划者将在周二上午的新闻发布会上公布更多的刺激措施，铁矿石上涨。【原文：Iron ore rose — following two sharply weekly gains — on speculation China’s top economic planner will unveil more stimulus measures at a press briefing on Tuesday morning.】

item.title: 印尼银行称已准备好在印尼盾暴跌后进行干预
item.description: 印尼央行表示，它已准备好出手支持印尼盾，因为印尼盾正经历自2023年以来最长的连跌。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank said it’s ready to step in to support the rupiah that’s in its longest losing streak since 2023.】

item.title: 法国奥拉诺公司在蒙古开发铀矿取得进展
item.description: 法国国有控股矿业公司奥拉诺公司（Orano SA）正在蒙古开发一个拖延已久、耗资数十亿美元的铀矿项目，该公司表示，该项目将于 2030 年开始生产核燃料。【原文：A long-delayed, multi-billion dollar uranium project in Mongolia under development by French state-controlled miner Orano SA could start producing the nuclear fuel by 2030, the company said.】

item.title: 对冲基金在日元出现 15 年来最大跌幅前买入日元
item.description: 就在日本新首相的鸽派言论和强劲的美国就业报告帮助日本货币创下 2009 年底以来最糟糕的一周之前，对冲基金转而看涨日元。【原文：Hedge funds turned bullish on the yen just before dovish comments by Japan’s new prime minister and a robust US jobs report helped spark the worst week for Japan’s currency since late 2009.】

item.title: 高盛称暴涨的中国股市可能再涨 20
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.）将其对中国股市的看涨评级上调至增持，加入了吹捧中国政府刺激经济举措积极影响的乐观主义阵营。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. upgraded its call on Chinese stocks to overweight, as it joined a camp of optimists that are touting the positive impact of Beijing’s stimulus blitz.】

item.title: 诺林丘金银行计划发行亏损以来的首支美元债券
item.description: 日本 Norinchukin 银行为其首次潜在的基准美元债券销售聘请了投资银行，因为这家农业贷款公司在 6 月份表示，由于债券损失，预计本财年将出现约 1.5 万亿日元（101 亿美元）的净亏损。【原文：Japan’s Norinchukin Bank hired investment banks for its first potential benchmark dollar bond sale since the agricultural lender said in June that it expects to report a net loss of about ¥1.5 trillion ($10.1 billion) in the current fiscal year due to bond losses.】
